brief_summary.textblock:
This study is designed to evaluate safety and efficacy of long-term exposure of KHK4827 in
      subjects with moderate to severe plaque psoriasis who have completed the preceding Study
      4827-002.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 3 Clinical Study of KHK4827

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Subject has voluntarily signed the written informed consent form to participate in
             this study

          -  Subject has completed the week 12 evaluation of Study 4827-002

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Subject has had a serious infection, defined as requiring systemic treatment with
             antibiotics or antivirals (excluding oral administration)

          -  Subject has been judged to be ineligible for participation in the study by the
             investigators/subinvestigators

facility.name: For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact Kyowa Hakko Kirin

clinical_study.official_title: An Extension Study in Subjects With Plaque Psoriasis

oversight_info.authority: Japan: Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence and types of adverse events and adverse reactions

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent improvement from baseline in Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI)
A 50% improvement in PASI (PASI 50), PASI 75, PASI 90 and PASI 100 response
Static physician's global assessment (sPGA) of "clear or almost clear (0 or 1)"
Body surface area involvement (BSA) of lesion
American College of Rheumatology (ACR) 20 (only in subjects with psoriasis arthritis)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Primary Purpose: Treatment
